a0016ebc-6ffe-428e-9a7a-e157f768e86c.description: Earners of the Nursing Assistant Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements for training under the guidelines of the Maryland Board of Nursing. Students are competent in performing routine patient care tasks under the supervision of nursing and medical staff. Students are eligible to apply for a CNA license from the Maryland Board of Nursing.
a0016ebc-6ffe-428e-9a7a-e157f768e86c.name: Nursing Assistant Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Nursing Assistant Workforce Training Certificate program. Topics include professionalism, team work, communication, math and measurements, basic patient care skills, disease processes, infection control and patient safety issues.
Complete supervised clinical experience in a long-term care facility caring for patients and working with staff and families.

5e8b738f-2882-4850-ad4f-cbe588e42e10.description: Completers of the Commercial UAS (Drone) Pilot Workforce Training Certificate are prepared to earn the FAA Remote Pilot in Command Certificate. Certificate training includes hands-on experience flying professional grade drones in real world scenarios; as well as training on software and applications to manipulate photos, video and data captured by the drones.
5e8b738f-2882-4850-ad4f-cbe588e42e10.name: Commercial UAS (Drone) Pilot Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the UAS Drone training series including ground school, flight school, FAA Remote Pilot Certification prep, aerial photo and video editing foundations, aerial data and flight log.
Complete UAS (Drone) Pilot capstone presenting examples of completed work and tasks to faculty and peers. Discuss how acquired skills can be applied to a variety of drone missions for future clients.
Complete a verified minimum of 50 total hours of recorded drone flight time.

fbadc2ab-cacb-4118-938a-5998821849c0.description: Earners of the Veterinary Assistant Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements for approval under the guidelines of the National Association of Veterinary Technicians in America (NAVTA). Students are competent in basic knowledge and skills needed for an entry-level position in a veterinary hospital are eligible to sit for the National Veterinary Assistant exam and become an Approved Veterinary Assistant (AVA).
fbadc2ab-cacb-4118-938a-5998821849c0.name: Veterinary Assistant Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Veterinary Assistant Workforce Training Certificate program covering topics including: Outpatient Care, Diagnostics and Pharmacy, Patient Care and Treatment, Surgery, Anesthesia and Emergency Care.
Complete supervised clinical practicum hours conducted during operating hours of a veterinary clinical site.

9c797eb3-31f7-4065-bd4a-83e37baf8d59.description: Earners of the Phlebotomy Technician Workforce Training Certificate have met the training requirements to be eligible to sit for the PBT exam administered through the American Society for Clinical Pathology (ASCP) Board of Certification.
9c797eb3-31f7-4065-bd4a-83e37baf8d59.name: Phlebotomy Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Phlebotomy Technician Workforce Training Certificate program to prepare to collect blood specimens. Topics include professionalism, anatomy & physiology, specimen collection, specimen processing and handling, and laboratory operations including safety and quality control.
Complete a supervised hands-on clinical experience in a local lab in cooperation with Carroll Hospital Center.

b1c3fd57-6df0-4e4e-941a-0659b4f8f8af.description: Earners of the Medical Assistant Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements for approval under the guidelines of the National Healthcareer Association (NHA). Students are competent in performing a variety of routine administrative and clinical tasks, as well as laboratory procedures. Students are prepared to take the certification exam and are eligible for national certification as a Certified Clinical Medical Assistant through the (NHA).
b1c3fd57-6df0-4e4e-941a-0659b4f8f8af.name: Medical Assistant Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete a program application and be accepted into the cohort training program.

Complete the Medical Assistant Workforce Training Certificate program in the classroom. Topics include medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, healthcare systems, professionalism, math, HIPAA, pharmacology, basic patient intake, electronic health records, basic EKG, lab techniques, phlebotomy and medical billing.

Complete a supervised clinical externship combining front and back medical office skills in a clinical setting working with staff, patients and families visiting the physician's office for well and sick visits.

81cdc655-4921-4554-b04c-69a2e67adaed.description: Earners of the Digital and Social Media Professional Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated the ability to plan, execute, and assess a comprehensive and effective social media campaign for corporations, government agencies, or non-profit organizations. Students are competent in skills such as explaining the benefits of social media in business, applying strategies and tactics to real projects, examining emerging trends and developing social media campaigns.
81cdc655-4921-4554-b04c-69a2e67adaed.name: Digital and Social Media Professional Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Digital and Social Media Professional Workforce Training Certificate program, including a workplace strategic digital and social media plan to be implemented, managed and assessed. Topics include basic tenets of digital and social media marketing, establishing and building a brand, reinforcing a brand through social media tools, measuring and evaluating marketing and outreach tactics, reasons for viral spread, and using search engine results to attract an audience.
Plan, present and defend a strategic digital and social media campaign that may be implemented, managed and assessed in the workplace.

a4ad09c1-12c9-40bc-94e9-1f402211df12.description: Earners of the Dental Assistant Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements for training courses approved by the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners. Students are competent in helping dentists and dental hygienists provide services to patients. Students are eligible to take the Radiation Health and Safety examination through the Dental Assisting National Board (DANB).
a4ad09c1-12c9-40bc-94e9-1f402211df12.name: Dental Assistant Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Dental Assistant Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating entry-level dental assisting job skills. Topics include professionalism, maintaining medical records, assisting with collection of patient information, instrument and patient preparation, taking and developing x-rays, and casting impressions. Training includes practical experience in a dental lab and practice using dental software in a computer lab.

4e9a8f93-ca4b-4222-acc0-a963b022d8d6.description: Earners of the Home Inspector Workforce Training Certificate have met the educational pre-licensing requirements of the Maryland Commission of Real Estate Appraisers and Home Inspectors for application for licensure as a home inspector. Students are competent in conducting inspections of residential dwellings and are prepared to sit for the National Home Inspector Examination.
4e9a8f93-ca4b-4222-acc0-a963b022d8d6.name: Home Inspector Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Home Inspector Workforce Training Certificate program in preparation for licensing as a home inspector. Topics include the following systems: structural, exterior, interior, roofing, plumbing, electrical, air conditioning, insulation and ventilation, fireplace and solid burning, and heating. Includes tips on starting your own home inspection business.

38d5cabb-1a72-4e1a-9ed2-e908f26de641.description: Penguin Random House License to Lead Workforce Training Certificate program is offered in partnership with Advantage C: A service of Carroll Community College. Completers of this program complete five training modules over a five month period, participate in on-site mentoring, and complete activities outside of class to apply learning to the workplace.
38d5cabb-1a72-4e1a-9ed2-e908f26de641.name: Penguin Random House License to Lead

badge_template_activities.title: "License to Lead: Foundations" includes role and responsibility of Group/Team Leader at Penguin Random House, demonstrating professionalism and presence as a supervisor, acting as a role model to effectively transition from "buddy" to "boss" and understanding self and others using the "As I see myself" assessment. This module introduces implementing the self-study element of the program.

"License to Lead: Relating" includes fundamental communication skills necessary for supervisors, fundamentals of motivation, feedback and relationship building through adaptive communication including verbal and non-verbal communication and listening skills.

"License to Lead: Connecting" includes successfully managing crucial or difficult conversations, handling conflict management and resistance, managing under-performance of others, and demonstrating HR-supported people policies.

"License to Lead: Directing" includes understanding and avoiding micromanagement, delegating effectively to others, building team and creating individual accountability, using coaching techniques to empower and drive results, creating an inclusive and respectful environment for all employees and fostering development of individual team members.

"License to Lead: Executing" includes supervising a high‐performance team and getting work done through others, setting team priorities and goals, effectively managing projects and deadlines, increasing productivity, employing time management skills and identifying & managing stakeholders.

84530366-10c6-43f7-951e-ab85d5e80434.description: Earners of the Registered Behavior Technician Workforce Training Certificate have met the 40-hour training requirement for the Registered Behavior Technician credential. Training is based on the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB) Task List for entry-level technicians implementing behavior/analytic services primarily for individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder.
84530366-10c6-43f7-951e-ab85d5e80434.name: Registered Behavior Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Registered Behavior Technician Workforce Training Certificate program to prepare to take the Registered Behavior Technician exam. Topics include behavioral health, socially acceptable behaviors, communication, social interaction, problem-solving skills and appropriate interventions to build these skills with individuals on the autism spectrum. Documentation and ethics & standards are outlined in direct implementation of skill acquisition and behavior reduction plans.
To be eligible to sit for the RBT exam, a high school diploma or equivalent is required, as well as an RBT Competency Assessment and background check.

166f199d-0e90-4231-b91b-a411fef49203.description: Earners of the Medical Biller Workforce Training Certificate are familiar with claim requirements for a variety of insurance companies including government payers. Students are prepared to sit for the Certified Professional Biller (CPB) national certification exam offered by the American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC).
166f199d-0e90-4231-b91b-a411fef49203.name: Medical Biller Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Medical Biller Workforce Training Certificate program in preparation for the CPB national certification exam. Topics include the lifecycle of a billing claim, how medical insurances work with the billing process in a physician's office, working with electronic medical records, billing claims and practice using medical billing software.

44179d1a-1015-4613-b2cd-3a1905edc783.description: Earners of the Pharmacy Technician Workforce Training Certificate are prepared to sit for one of the national pharmacy technician certification exams: the PTCE offered by the Pharmacy Technician Certification Board and the ExCPT offered by the National Healthcareer Association. Individuals who pass either exam are given the designation of CPhT (Certified Pharmacy Technician).
44179d1a-1015-4613-b2cd-3a1905edc783.name: Pharmacy Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Pharmacy Technician Workforce Training Certificate program to prepare for certification exam. Topics include pharmaceutical calculations, pharmacy law, medical terminology, aseptic technique, dosage unit conversions and a review of the top 200 drugs. Training includes virtual and practical experience in a mock pharmacy.

646f5453-b020-4df0-97bc-adefef4c36a9.description: Earners of the Real Estate Sales Agent Workforce Training Certificate have met the educational requirements of the Maryland Real Estate Commission for application for licensure as a real estate salesperson. Students are competent in helping clients buy, sell and rent properties and are prepared to sit for the Real Estate Sales Agent License Exam.
646f5453-b020-4df0-97bc-adefef4c36a9.name: Real Estate Sales Agent Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Real Estate Sales Agent Workforce Training Certificate program to qualify to take the Real Estate Salespersons Examination. Topics include real property, leasing, contracts, agencies and listings, property transfers, appraising, financing, license law, human relations, ethics, basic mathematics and the real estate day-to-day activities.

a2ee17d3-4bca-4d10-be0f-d7d3e75807bd.description: Earners of the Welder Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated workplace welding skills. Students have successfully met welding standards and completed projects to be eligible to receive American Welding Society (AWS) "General Welding Certification" if optional certification testing is successfully completed.
a2ee17d3-4bca-4d10-be0f-d7d3e75807bd.name: Welder Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Welder Workforce Certificate Training program series in preparation for certification. Topics include safety, fluxes and base metals, basics of torches (electrode, gas and oxy-acetylene), brazing and soft soldering, and proper selection of appropriate welding process for various metals.
Complete an individual project for submission to the American Welding Society that meets tolerance specs for AWS certification.

831bc906-fc35-41ce-8f36-c11d82cc03ee.description: Earners of the Assisted Living Manager Workforce Training Certificate have met the OHCQ training requirements for Assisted Living Managers.
831bc906-fc35-41ce-8f36-c11d82cc03ee.name: Assisted Living Manager Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Assisted Living Manager Workforce Training Certificate program to prepare to take the certification exam. Topics include the philosophy of assisted living, aging process and its impact, assessment and level of care waiver, service planning, clinical management, admission and discharge criteria, nutrition and food safety, dementia, mental health and behavior management, end-of-life care, management and operation, emergency planning, quality assurance and the survey process.

Must possess a high school diploma, a high school equivalency diploma, or other appropriate education and have experience to conduct the responsibilities specified in this regulation, be a minimum 21 years old or older; and have two years experience in a health care related field.

91859850-cd43-494c-ac9f-fc4cf3d29e64.description: Earners of the Medicine Aide Workforce Training Certificate are eligible to become a Certified Medicine Aide by the Maryland Board of Nursing.
91859850-cd43-494c-ac9f-fc4cf3d29e64.name: Medicine Aide Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Medicine Aide Training Workforce Training Certificate program preparing persons currently employed Geriatric Nursing Assistants for the safe preparation, administration and charting of routine medicines.
Must have a minimum of one year full-time current employment as a geriatric nursing assistant with recommendation from Director of Nursing.

ed819b8b-4f3c-4e47-aefa-32c1fd035779.description: Earners of the Management Development Workforce Training Certificate are well-versed in essential tools and principles for quality management practice applicable to any industry.
ed819b8b-4f3c-4e47-aefa-32c1fd035779.name: Management Development Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Management Development Workforce Training Certificate program. Topics include management basics, building a winning team, interviewing and selecting employees, coaching, effective performance appraisals, managing using Emotional Intelligence, HR legal issues, conflict management, fostering diversity, leading change, communication skills for managers and leading high performance teams.

df48b6b2-e78c-4987-ad32-193cb2e16c82.description: Earners of the Media Production Specialist Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated the ability to produce, edit and manipulate images, graphics, audio and video. Students have worked with professional technology at the Community Media Center to plan, develop and deliver a multi-media project.
df48b6b2-e78c-4987-ad32-193cb2e16c82.name: Media Production Specialist Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Media Production Specialist Workforce Training Certificate program that includes generating a multi-media capstone project from conception to reality. Topics include basic tenets of media production planning, developing storyboards, selecting delivery platforms, editing and producing audio, capturing images and sound to incorporate into video and editing images and sound.
Prepare, present and defend a final multi-media project in a film festival-style atmosphere to an audience of peers, community members and Community Media Center staff.

4ed635ba-0850-4189-aa4b-94a27ba6cb4e.description: This training is offered in partnership with Advantage C: A service of Carroll Community College to employees of Maryland Department of Transportation State Highway Administration (MDOT-SHA). Completers of this program explore concepts to help understand management styles, interact with others more effectively, create an inclusive and inspiring work environment, communicate ideas and make better decisions.
4ed635ba-0850-4189-aa4b-94a27ba6cb4e.name: MDOT-SHA: Supervisory Training & Engagement Program (STEP)

badge_template_activities.title: "Exploring One's Leadership Style through DiSC" provides awareness and understanding of the various DiSC® styles, providing students with an opportunity to identify their own work style and preferences that influence their behavior as a manager. Insight gained allows managers to identify their strengths, motivators, triggers, and potential vulnerabilities as they engage with others in the workplace.
"Communication Skills for Leaders" helps employees hone both communication and influencing skills; helping them to deliver the right message for winning outcomes.

"Fostering Diversity in the Workplace" discusses how people from different backgrounds, generations and experiences contribute to the richness and competitive edge of an organization. Also explored are ways to create an atmosphere of inclusion, understanding and appreciation – fostering an environment of creativity, collaboration and overall team performance.

"Critical Thinking and Creative Problem Solving" provides hands-on experience using critical thinking skills necessary to breakdown simple and complex problems, inviting thinking outside the individual’s regular patterns to discover innovative solutions allows for the recognition of opportunities for improved performance, profitability, and innovative and entrepreneurial solutions.

"Leading High Performing Teams " empowers employees to deal with change in the workplace - both personally and as team leaders. Topics include understanding both positive and negative effects of change, learning personal response to change, helping to lead employees through change, seeing change as an opportunity, and communication strategies during change.

"Building Conflict Competence" explores the nature of conflict and recognize their personal conflict management tendencies – both constructive and destructive. Common “hot buttons” that can trigger conflict are reviewed as well as techniques to diffuse workplace problems before they magnify.

"Organizational Skills for Busy Manager" is designed for busy managers operating in hybrid work environments who wish to enhance their organization skills to increase daily productivity and effectiveness.

65011107-bab2-4845-bf36-97ac1e6df890.description: Earners of the Emergency Medical Technician Workforce Training Certificate have met required training and are eligible to sit for the National Registry Emergency Medical Technician written exam and the MIEMSS practical evaluation.
65011107-bab2-4845-bf36-97ac1e6df890.name: Emergency Medical Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Emergency Medical Technician Workforce Training Certificate program including classroom instruction, distance learning and lab hours. Topics include medical, legal and ethical issues, basic anatomy & physiology, patient care management, medical emergencies, basic cardiac life support, respiratory emergencies, pharmacological treatments, EMS operations, trauma emergencies and special patient populations.

2d6ea542-f452-4cf4-b309-31fd5fb45566.description: This training is offered in partnership with Advantage C: A service of Carroll Community College to employees of Knorr Brake Company (KBC). Completers of this program complete training modules over a ten month period that address essential leadership competencies, identified by the organization, through classroom training and experiential learning.
2d6ea542-f452-4cf4-b309-31fd5fb45566.name: Knorr Brake Company: 2022 Leadership Development Training (LEAD)

badge_template_activities.title: "Communication Skills for Leaders" helps employees hone both communication and influencing skills, and helps them to deliver the right message for winning outcomes.

"Conflict Management" facilitates creating a climate of collaboration. Discussion includes the five conflict management styles, identifying individual styles, and determining which conflict management styles are most effective in various situations.

"Exploring Your Leadership Style through DiSC" provides instruction on exploring and identifying personal leadership styles that can be leveraged in the workplace. A review of the DiSC framework and its fundamental concepts include utilizing the DiSC tool to identify individual strengths, motivations, triggers, and potential vulnerabilities as a new manager. Using insight from the DiSC tool to develop stronger working relationships and foster a healthier workplace environment are discussed.

"Negotiating for Winning Outcomes " helps employees strengthen critical skills needed to negotiate and advocate for themselves and their teams when there are limited resources, competing demands, and/or differences of opinion. Participants learn to identify other party’s decision-making criteria, objections and fears and effectively address them to attain desired outcomes.

"Critical Thinking and Creative Problem Solving" provides hands-on experience using critical thinking skills necessary to breakdown simple and complex problems, inviting thinking outside the individual’s regular patterns to discover innovative solutions allows for the recognition of opportunities for improved performance, profitability, and innovative and entrepreneurial solutions.

"Leading Change in the Workplace " empowers employees to deal with change in the workplace - both personally and as team leaders. Topics include understanding both positive and negative effects of change, learning personal response to change, helping to lead employees through change, seeing change as an opportunity, and communication strategies during change.

d1f7d7fc-56ae-4c7c-8c08-08afb5942835.description: Earners of the EKG Technician Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements for training and are prepared to sit for the Certified Cardiographic Technician Examination administered by Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI).
d1f7d7fc-56ae-4c7c-8c08-08afb5942835.name: EKG Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the EKG Technician Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating competency as a Cardiographic Technician. Topics include professionalism, medical terminology, anatomy & physiology, EKGs, stress tests, arrhythmias, pharmacology & pace makers, and Holter monitors.

68c81460-a230-447b-9c4f-c984e626aeb1.description: Earners of the Sterile Processing Technician Workforce Training Certificate have met the training requirements to be eligible to take the Certified Registered Central Service Technician (CRCST) certification exam offered by the International Association of Healthcare Central Service Materiel Management (IAHCSMM).
68c81460-a230-447b-9c4f-c984e626aeb1.name: Sterile Processing Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Sterile Processing Technician Workforce Training Certificate program to prepare to take the certification exam. Topics include anatomy & physiology, microbiology, instrumentation, safety standards, cleaning, decontamination, disinfection, preparation, infection control, sterilization process, packaging, wrapping, distribution & inventory management, documentation and ethics & standards.

7c897035-c44c-4bff-9c52-7e31c4cd87b3.description: Advantage C, a service of Carroll Community College, is pleased to offer Leadership Development Training in partnership with the Carroll County State's Attorney's Office. Successful participants in this program complete six (6) training modules covering organization-specific leadership competencies through customized classroom training.
7c897035-c44c-4bff-9c52-7e31c4cd87b3.name: Carroll County State's Attorney's Office Leadership Development Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: “Management Basics” provides participants with the core skills needed to ensure their success as a front-line supervisor or manager. Participants learn about the role of a manager and explores contemporary management theories. Topics include team building, relationship building, communications, delegation, and professionalism and ethics.

“Leadership Essentials” explores the critical leadership skills needed to build a team and influence positive results in the workplace.  Topics include: distinguishing between leadership and management, exploring leadership styles, creating and communicating a shared vision, fostering innovative thinking, and inspiring and developing others.  At the end of the class, leaders will develop action items to affect change in their unique work environments.

“Effective Performance Appraisals” provide participants with an understanding of the factors that influence employee performance. Topics include: documenting both effective and ineffective performance, creating SMART goals, and writing employee development plans that motivate. Rater errors, pitfalls to avoid, and tips for conducting a successful performance review are also discussed.

“Coaching Employees to Peak Performance” provides an overview of the manager’s role as coach, the four facets of performance coaching, how to diagnose performance issues, elements of a coaching conversation, and ways to reward and recognize employee progress and performance.
“Communication Skills for Managers” helps participants hone critical communication and influencing skills, and explores ways to craft an effective message for winning outcomes.

“Leading Change in the Workplace” empowers participants to deal with change in the workplace – both personally and as team leaders. Topics include understanding both positive and negative effects of change, learning personal response to change, helping to lead employees through change, seeing change as an opportunity, and communication during change.

1f550891-dbe2-4166-9226-7cefb7dd30f8.description: Earners of the Computer Graphic Designer Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated the ability to learn digital design platforms. Students are competent in skills such as designing and manipulating images using graphic software for use in print and web-based marketing materials, brochures, flyers and logos.
1f550891-dbe2-4166-9226-7cefb7dd30f8.name: Computer Graphic Designer Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Computer Graphic Designer Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating the ability to learn and work with a variety of design software programs. Topics include designing and manipulating images and photos using Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign to create, edit and enhance material for a variety of marketing platforms.

42e52a8e-60c6-41fd-8381-dbf39486511a.description: Earners of the Fundamental Office Technology Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated the ability to learn computer applications for business and personal use. Students are competent in basic skills using a variety of Microsoft Office products.
42e52a8e-60c6-41fd-8381-dbf39486511a.name: Fundamental Office Technology Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Fundamental Office Technology Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating the ability to learn and work with a variety of Microsoft Office software programs. Topics include project-based exercises utilizing fundamental processes in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint as well as Outlook, Access or Publisher.

a70a0d55-85b7-4def-a906-225e9dcc8f44.description: This training is offered in partnership with Advantage C: A service of Carroll Community College to employees of Knorr Brake Company (KBC). Completers of this program complete eight training modules over a ten month period that address essential leadership competencies, identified by the organization, through classroom training and experiential learning.
a70a0d55-85b7-4def-a906-225e9dcc8f44.name: Knorr Brake Company: 2018 Leadership Development Training (LEAD)

badge_template_activities.title: "Communication Skills for Leaders" helps employees hone both communication and influencing skills, and helps them to deliver the right message for winning outcomes.

"Conflict Management" facilitates creating a climate of collaboration. Discussion includes the five conflict management styles, identifying individual styles, and determining which conflict management styles are most effective in various situations.

"Leading with Emotional Intelligence" introduces the power of Emotional Intelligence (EI) and its effect on employee engagement, motivation, productivity and retention of top talent. Participants have an opportunity to self-reflect, identify their areas of strength, as well as identify opportunities to strengthen their own emotional intelligence. This module includes creation of a plan to further develop their emotional intelligence and utilize it in the workplace.

"Critical Thinking and Creative Problem Solving" provides hands-on experience using critical thinking skills necessary to breakdown simple and complex problems, inviting thinking outside the individual’s regular patterns to discover innovative solutions allows for the recognition of opportunities for improved performance, profitability, and innovative and entrepreneurial solutions.

"Building and Strengthening Customer Relationships" includes identifying  internal and external customers, behaviors that demonstrate exceptional customer service, how to provide and receive effective service level feedback, and exploring ways to evaluate and improve customer service at all levels of the organization. This module includes designing an action plan to evaluate and improve individual and unit/team service levels.

"HR Legal Issues for Managers" provides and overview of the major employment laws and how they impact day-to-day activities. The human resource function and legal issues that impact a manager, supervisor or team leader’s role are practiced utilizing case studies to apply the principles learned.

"Strategic Planning and Visioning" enables leaders to develop a strategic view of the organization, evaluate how they assist in the achievement of strategic goals and vision attainment, and help them to develop and align their goals and activities to support the organization.

"Leading High-Performance Teams" explores the basics of team dynamics, the stages of team formation, and utilizing individual strengths to bring out the best in all team members. Participants discover their own leadership style and explore its impact on team performance.

a955d5bb-2b39-45de-aca1-5ee385861880.description: Earners of the Nurse Refresher Workforce Training Certificate have met the requirements to apply for reactivation of an RN/LPN license under the guidelines of the Maryland Board of Nursing. Nurses who have been out of the workplace and are planning to return to work are competent in performing routine nursing skills.
a955d5bb-2b39-45de-aca1-5ee385861880.name: Nurse Refresher Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Nurse Refresher Workforce Training Certificate program. Learning experiences include managing patient care, documentation, medication administration, emergency procedures, communication, evaluation of patient care and team member responsibilities.
Complete hands-on review of patient care, medication administration, and emergency procedures as well as participate in lab simulations.

f13cf98d-46f9-48ee-8e34-a687d13e1c63.description: Earners of the Personal Fitness Trainer Workforce Training Certificate are competent in basic knowledge and skills necessary to take the American Council on Exercise (ACE) Certified Personal Fitness Trainer exam.
f13cf98d-46f9-48ee-8e34-a687d13e1c63.name: Personal Fitness Trainer Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ACE Certification for Personal Fitness Trainer preparation program. Course includes classroom lecture and hands-on lab work in a fitness facility and gym. Topics include fundamentals of human anatomy and physiology, body movement during daily living and exercise, client interviewing, pre-program assessment strategies, corrective exercise planning, fitness planning and healthy lifestyle behavior modification methods.

f3b1ae13-0161-4e4f-be0c-9ee1c64999ed.description: Earners of the QuickBooks Pro Workforce Training Certificate are prepared to take the Certiport Intuit QuickBooks Certified User (QBCU) exam.
f3b1ae13-0161-4e4f-be0c-9ee1c64999ed.name: QuickBooks Pro Specialist Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the QuickBooks Pro Specialist Workforce Training Certificate program covering the essentials of using QuickBooks Pro accounting software. Topics include classifying and recording numerical data, routine calculating, posting and verifying duties to obtain primary financial data for use in maintaining accounting records for small businesses.

44217da6-02b7-4bbe-a71f-47805800d1bc.description: Earners of the Electrical Helper Workforce Training Certificate have acquired the necessary skills to work as an entry-level electrical helper. Students are prepared to install basic electrical devices, interpret blueprints and schematics, and assist with residential and light commercial wiring projects.
44217da6-02b7-4bbe-a71f-47805800d1bc.name: Electrical Helper Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Electrical Helper Workforce Training Certificate program. Topics include professionalism, customer service, worksite safety, use of measuring equipment, use of hand tools, basic circuitry, blueprint reading, wire and conduit bending and testing equipment.

71f1b58a-7694-42d5-a70d-77ffdb50b2e9.description: Earners of the HVAC Technician Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated skills needed to work in entry-level positions with Environmental Systems employers. Upon completion of training and the refrigerant handling certification exam administered in class, students are eligible for EPA Refrigerant Reclamation Certification.
71f1b58a-7694-42d5-a70d-77ffdb50b2e9.name: HVAC Technician Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the HVAC Technician Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating the ability to learn heating and cooling theory and work with basic installation techniques. Topics include basic principles of electricity, soldering and brazing, and piping practices for copper, plastic and ferrous metal.

6ee61b7b-a67f-41bd-9a6f-7556af245720.description: Advantage C, a service of Carroll Community College, is pleased to offer Leadership Development Training in partnership with Knorr Brake Company (KBC). Successful participants in this program complete six (6) training modules covering organization-specific leadership competencies through classroom training and experiential learning.
6ee61b7b-a67f-41bd-9a6f-7556af245720.name: Knorr Brake Company: 2019 Leadership Development Training (LEAD)

badge_template_activities.title: "Communication Skills for Leaders" helps employees hone both communication and influencing skills, and helps them to deliver the right message for winning outcomes.

"Conflict Management" facilitates creating a climate of collaboration. Discussion includes the five conflict management styles, identifying individual styles, and determining which conflict management styles are most effective in various situations.

"Negotiating for Winning Outcomes " helps employees strengthen critical skills needed to negotiate and advocate for themselves and their teams when there are limited resources, competing demands, and/or differences of opinion.  Participants learn to identify other party’s decision-making criteria, objections and fears and effectively address them to attain desired outcomes.

"Critical Thinking and Creative Problem Solving" provides hands-on experience using critical thinking skills necessary to breakdown simple and complex problems, inviting thinking outside the individual’s regular patterns to discover innovative solutions allows for the recognition of opportunities for improved performance, profitability, and innovative and entrepreneurial solutions.

"Leading Change in the Workplace " empowers employees to deal with change in the workplace - both personally and as team leaders. Topics include understanding both positive and negative effects of change, learning personal response to change, helping to lead employees through change, seeing change as an opportunity, and communication strategies during change.

"Leading High-Performance Teams" explores the basics of team dynamics, the stages of team formation, and utilizing individual strengths to bring out the best in all team members. Participants discover their own leadership style and explore its impact on team performance.

8a7e6483-d7bc-4b50-9c93-7dc4b797740e.description: Earners of the Floral Designer Workforce Training Certificate have demonstrated the ability to create a variety of floral arrangements. Students are competent in arranging live, dried, or silk flowers and greenery to create decorative displays, as well as conducting client consultations.
8a7e6483-d7bc-4b50-9c93-7dc4b797740e.name: Floral Design Workforce Training Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Floral Design Workforce Training Certificate program demonstrating the ability to create a variety of floral arrangements. Topics include principles of design, color selection, pricing, customer satisfaction as well as selecting flowers, containers, ribbons and other decorative accessories for special occasions including weddings, parties and memorials.
